title: How to Use an Assault Rifle on Halo 3

steps.headline: Know when to shoot.
steps.description: If you see an enemy across the map, don't shoot him. You'll just end up wasting ammo or probably getting sniped.

steps.headline: Shoot in bursts.
steps.description: It will be more accurate and won't spread as much. The AR does best at short to medium ranges.

steps.headline: Reload when you have time.
steps.description: It usually takes a few bullets to take out a couple targets. You don't want to get caught out in the open and end up having to reload in the middle of a fight.

steps.headline: Stay back 2–3 feet (0.6–0.9 m) when taking cover behind a wall or barrier.
steps.description: The barrel of the Assault Rifle is longer than it looks to the other player and they'll shoot it and possibly lose health.

steps.headline: Never use the binoculars as a scope.
steps.description: They are binoculars, to see enemies at a distance.

steps.headline: Use your secondary weapon if you are out of ammo.
steps.description: This is another way to kill an enemy's Assault Rifle ammo.

text: Know when to shoot. If you see an enemy across the map, don't shoot him. You'll just end up wasting ammo or probably getting sniped. Shoot in bursts. It will be more accurate and won't spread as much. The AR does best at short to medium ranges. Reload when you have time. It usually takes a few bullets to take out a couple targets. You don't want to get caught out in the open and end up having to reload in the middle of a fight. Stay back 2–3 feet (0.6–0.9 m) when taking cover behind a wall or barrier. The barrel of the Assault Rifle is longer than it looks to the other player and they'll shoot it and possibly lose health. Never use the binoculars as a scope. They are binoculars, to see enemies at a distance. Use your secondary weapon if you are out of ammo. This is another way to kill an enemy's Assault Rifle ammo.
